qas.question: Who did Princess Margaret want to marry?
What did Queen Elizabeth ask Margaret to do instead of marring Townsend?
What act would the Church of England not permit?
Who did Princess Margaret marry in 1960?
What is the name of one of Peter Townsend's sons?
In what year did Princess Margaret break up with Peter Townsend?
How much older was Antony Armstrong-Jones than Princess Margaret?
What was the Earl of Snowdon named?
What was Martin Charteris' marital status in 1960?

context: Amid preparations for the coronation, Princess Margaret informed her sister that she wished to marry <a0_0><b8_0>Peter<b8_0/> Townsend<a0_0/>, a <b9_0>divorcé<b9_0/>‚ <b7_0>16 years<b7_0/> Margaret's senior, with two sons from his previous marriage. The Queen asked them to <a1_0>wait for a year<a1_0/>; in the words of <b5_0>Martin<b5_0/> Charteris, "the Queen was naturally sympathetic towards the Princess, but I think she thought—she hoped—given time, the affair would peter out." Senior politicians were against the match and the Church of England did not permit <a2_0>remarriage after divorce<a2_0/>. If Margaret had contracted a civil marriage, she would have been expected to renounce her right of succession. Eventually, she decided to abandon her plans with Townsend. In <b6_0>1960<b6_0/>, she married <a3_0>Antony Armstrong-Jones<a3_0/>, who was created <a4_0>Earl of Snowdon<a4_0/> the following year. They divorced in 1978; she did not remarry.
